page.title: 01Bratton Clovelly & Sourton
page.content: The area of land lying between Bratton Clovelly and Sourton has the small river Thrushel running through it from north east to south west. the land is undulating and varies from 50 to 750 feel above sea level. Farming is the only industry of any significance and the majority of farms are from 50 to 200 acres and are run by the farmer and his family. Due to the sloping ground, the relativly small field size, the high rainfall, and the soil type, the majority of the land is down to permanent or semi-permanent grass, with some patches of dciduous woodland, rough grazing, and areas of wet marshy ground in the river valley. The farming is based on the production of milk, beef and sheep and the majority of residential property in the area belongs to the farms. There are some
